titles.title: A bill to amend the Food Security Act of 1985 to permit the enrollment of cropland containing agricultural drainage wells and naturally occurring sinkholes in the conservation reserve program.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.

bill.summary: 3/4/1988--Introduced. Amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to direct the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out a ground water pilot program in conjunction with the conservation reserve program to assist owners and operators of land: (1) containing agricultural drainage wells or naturally occurring sinkholes; or (2) affected by water quality problems resulting from agricultural and water management practices. Requires participating owners or operators to: (1) retire permanently from the base and allotment history applicable to acreage placed in the reserve a number of acres equal to the number of acres placed in the reserve; and (2) not use for agricultural purposes other land drawing from the same water supply as land placed in the reserve.
